title: Sending message failed

thunderbird

when sending, an error comes up saying i cannot send more than 300 messages an hour but that is not the case, i am barely trying to send 10 an hour, need this fixed asap as my whole business runs around emails and need this fixed so as to not further inconvenience my business and clients.

Also getting lots of spam coming through suddenly
creator: glass2

title: Spam control
content: I am not sure whether this question should be classified under "Email and messaging" or "Settings" but here goes. I am getting a lot of emails from people and organizations that I would rather not open and look at or am bothered to do so. And setting up filters for each and every email sender would clutter up the workings of Thunderbird creating a significant lag during startup and mail download (am using IMAP). Is it possible to have a sender or organization set up in the message filter which then during the next go-around returns the email to sender with a subject line saying "Returned to sender, no such address"? Thanks for any consideration of this request. James
creator: smnckl

title: Address Book
content: Hi I recently changed over to Microsoft 11, my computer was installed and set up by Computer Help by a IT Consultant. If I am unable to find out what is wrong I will go to Gmail only, which is a shame I have used TB for years. Ann Ferrari joeannferrari@gmail.com

title: can't reply or write a new emails
content: I hit some key by mistake while I was replying to an email and the message disappeared. It still showed up on the tool bar when I hover over the Tbird icon, but it will not click up onto the screen. I can no longer reply to emails or write a new email. I tried a system restore, which restored the old Thunderbird display (which I like better than the new one anyway) but it did not fix the problem, I still can't reply or write. I tried starting Tbird in safe mode but that didn't work either. I can't reply to messages or write a new message. All I can do is see incoming messages.
creator: edbdchi

title: andriod thunderbird and desktop thunderbird  sync
content: Hello I have managed to get Thunderbird on my android phone and get my email accounts on it. I want to sync what i do on the android phone to the desktop Thunderbird so I can see all my email accounts on there too. Also if I make changes on one or the other I'd like it to be the same on the other. essentually I want them to sync with each other for setting changes.

title: unable to import outlook data into thunderbird
content: hi - I'm trying to import from outlook 2003 all my accounts and data (incl email, calendar, address book, etc.) into my just now downloaded thunderbird. when I select the import from outlook option in the import tool, I just get a message saying "no profile found". outlook 2003 is currently installed on the same computer and the .pst file is available in the appropriate folder. I'd greatly appreciate any info on how to make this data transfer. thanks. Charlie

title: Print an attachment

I cannot see any differences in the setups. We are both using Linux Mint. I have no problem printing files normally.

title: Problema con Thunderbird tras recuperación de carpetas
content:
Buenos días,

Debido a un error, se han borrado todas las carpetas relacionadas con Thunderbird, incluidas el perfil y los correos locales. Afortunadamente, hemos podido recuperar dichos ficheros. Sin embargo, al cargar las carpetas locales en Thunderbird, no se muestran correos electrónicos en su interior, incluso en carpetas de gran tamaño (hasta 200MB).

Hemos intentado reparar tanto las carpetas individualmente como la base de datos global, pero el problema persiste.

Agradeceríamos su orientación para resolver este problema.

Gracias de antemano.

--

Good morning,

Due to an error, all folders related to Thunderbird, including the profile and local emails, have been deleted. Fortunately, we were able to recover these files. However, upon loading the local folders in Thunderbird, no emails are displayed inside them, even in large folders (up to 200MB).

We have attempted to repair both the individual folders and the global database, but the issue persists.

We would appreciate your guidance to resolve this problem.

Thank you in advance.

--
creator: jc88.sti
